com.fortify.util.rest.connection

Class AbstractRestConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fortify.util.rest.connection.AbstractRestConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IRestConnection, AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ADORestConnection, ArcherBasicRestConnection, FoDBasicRestConnection, JiraRestConnection, OctaneBasicRestConnection, RestConnection, RestConnectionWithCredentials, SSCBasicRestConnection

    public abstract class AbstractRestConnection
extends Object
implements IRestConnection

    Base class for low-level functionality for accessing REST API's. Concrete implementations can override various methods to fine-tune behavior related to calling REST API's. Instances of this class are configured using a corresponding AbstractRestConnectionConfig instance. Concrete implementations usually provide a static builder() method that returns a subclass of AbstractRestConnectionConfig which also implements the IRestConnectionBuilder interface, allowing clients to easily build a concrete AbstractRestConnection implementation.

    Implementations may choose to also provide more high-level functionality. Usually such implementations provide an api() method that provides access to these more high-level functionalities, keeping the actual connection implementation lean and clean.

      • initializeConnection

        protected void initializeConnection(String httpMethod)
        Authenticating with the server may require several round trips, especially when using NTLM authentication. For HTTP methods that may contain a (possibly large) payload, we do not want this payload to be included in the authentication requests for the following reasons:
        • Re-sending a large payload multiple times can have a negative impact on performance
        • If the client sends a non-repeatable entity, any round trip after the initial attempt (which may fail due to authentication being required) will trigger an exception
        As such, if the doInitializeAuthenticatedConnection() method returns true, we call initializeAuthenticatedConnection() to pre-authenticate the connection for the HTTP methods returned by getHttpMethodsToPreAuthenticate().
        Parameters:
        httpMethod - for which to initialize the connection

      • doInitializeAuthenticatedConnection

        protected boolean doInitializeAuthenticatedConnection()
        Indicate whether the initializeAuthenticatedConnection() method should be called for the HTTP methods returned by getHttpMethodsToPreAuthenticate(). By default, this method returns false if preemptive basic authentication is enabled (assuming the connection will be automatically authenticated upon the actual request). If preemptive basic authentication is disabled, this method will return true.
        Returns:
        Flag indicating whether initializeAuthenticatedConnection() should be called if necessary

      • initializeAuthenticatedConnection

        protected void initializeAuthenticatedConnection()

        Subclasses should override this method to set up an authenticated connection. Implementations would usually execute some cheap request (for example a GET or HEAD request on a resource that only returns a small payload), resulting in authentication to be performed if needed.

        Note that the request to authenticate cannot use any of the HTTP methods returned by getHttpMethodsToPreAuthenticate() as this would result in an endless loop.

        Also note that if a subclass does not override the doInitializeAuthenticatedConnection() and/or doPreemptiveBasicAuthentication() methods, this method will never be called (since preemptive basic authentication is enabled by default, doInitializeAuthenticatedConnection() will always return false). As such, we provide a default empty implementation instead of making this an abstract method.

        protected <T> T checkResponseAndGetOutput(String httpMethod,

        response - Response to be checked and from which to retrieve the response contents
        returnType - Return type for the contents to be retrieved from the given Response
        Returns:

      • getResource

        public final javax.ws.rs.client.WebTarget getResource(String uriString)
        Get a WebTarget object for the given uriString. If the given uriString is an absolute URI, it will be used as-is. If the given uriString is relative, it will be appended to the configured REST base URL. See URI.resolve(String) for more details.
        Specified by:
        getResource in interface IRestConnection
        Parameters:
        uriString - Absolute or relative URI for which to get a WebTarget instance.
        Returns:
        A WebTarget instance for the given URI.

      • getClient

        public final javax.ws.rs.client.Client getClient()
        Get the cached client for executing requests. If the client has not been previously cached, this method will call createClient() to create a new client and then cache it.
        Returns:
        Cached Client instance if available, new Client instance otherwise

      • createClient

        protected javax.ws.rs.client.Client createClient()

        Create a new client for executing requests. The default implementation creates a client based on Apache HttpClient 4.x by calling createClientConfig() to get the client configuration, and then calls ClientBuilder.newClient(javax.ws.rs.core.Configuration) to generate a new Client instance. Some of the Jersey-specific settings like the CookieStore and whether to use preemptive basic authentication can be specified by overriding the corresponding methods.

        Subclasses can override this method to create a different type of client. Note however that other classes may depend on the use of Apache HttpClient.

        Subclasses that would would like to customize Apache HttpClient behavior should override createClientConfig().

        Returns:
        New Client instance

      • createClientConfig

        protected org.glassfish.jersey.client.ClientConfig createClientConfig()

      • createCredentialsProvider

        protected org.apache.http.client.CredentialsProvider createCredentialsProvider(AbstractRestConnectionConfig<?> config)
        Create a CredentialsProvider for the given configuration.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        CredentialsProvider instance, or null if no credentials available

      • createCredentialsProvider

        protected org.apache.http.client.CredentialsProvider createCredentialsProvider()
        Create the CredentialsProvider to use for requests. This default implementation returns a BasicCredentialsProvider instance.
        Returns:
        CredentialsProvider instance

      • getServiceUnavailableRetryStrategy

      • createCookieStore

        protected org.apache.http.client.CookieStore createCookieStore()
        Create the CookieStore to use between requests. This default implementation returns a BasicCookieStore instance. Subclasses can override this method to return an alternative CookieStore implementation, or null if cookies should not be maintained between requests.
        Returns:
        CookieStore instance

      • doPreemptiveBasicAuthentication

        protected boolean doPreemptiveBasicAuthentication()
        Indicate whether preemptive basic authentication should be used. If this method returns true, the Basic Authentication header will be sent on all requests, preventing multiple round trips for performing authentication. This default implementation returns
        Returns:
        Flag specifying whether preemptive Basic Authentication should be performed

      • getHttpMethodsToPreAuthenticate

        protected Set<String> getHttpMethodsToPreAuthenticate()
        Subclasses can override this method to return the set of HTTP methods for which an authenticated connection should be initialized before executing the actual request. All returned HTTP methods should be in upper case. By default, this method returns POST, PUT and PATCH.
        Returns:
        Set of HTTP Methods that should be pre-authenticated

      • updateWebTarget

        protected javax.ws.rs.client.WebTarget updateWebTarget(javax.ws.rs.client.WebTarget webTarget)
        Update the given WebTarget before executing the request. By default this method simply returns the given target. Subclasses can override this method to add information to the target that is required for every request, for example to add query parameters that need to be included in every request.
        Parameters:
        webTarget - to be updated
        Returns:
        updated webTarget

      • updateBuilder

        protected javax.ws.rs.client.Invocation.Builder updateBuilder(javax.ws.rs.client.Invocation.Builder builder)
        Update the given Invocation.Builder before executing the request. By default this method simply returns the given builder. Subclasses can override this method to add information to the builder that is required for every request, for example to add headers that need to be included in every request.
        Parameters:
        builder - to be updated
        Returns:
        updated builder
